snippet: Citing swimmer deaths, Western Australia State has started a catch-and-kill policy for larger sharks, but environmentalists say it will have a deleterious effect on the ecosystem.
abstract: Western Australia State, citing swimmer deaths, has started a catch-and-kill policy for larger sharks that environmentalists say will have deleterious effect on ecosystem; policy flies in the face of global efforts to protect sharks, whose numbers have been in decline; opponents of the cull policy have mounted protests and consulted lawyers about trying to halt it in the courts.
lead_paragraph: Citing swimmer deaths, Western Australia State has started a catch-and-kill policy for larger sharks, but environmentalists say it will have a deleterious effect on the ecosystem.

headline.main: Australian Catch-and-Kill Shark Policy, Meant to Reassure, Horrifies Some
headline.print_headline: Shark Culling in Western Australia Draws Ire of Conservationists
